meanings.definition: The main body of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The fuselage of the plane holds the passengers and cargo.
meanings.sent2: The pilot sits in the cockpit at the front of the fuselage.
meanings.sent3: The fuselage felt like a giant metal tube soaring through the sky.
meanings.sent4: The fuselage, like a protective shell, encased everyone inside.
meanings.sent5: The fuselage, a long tube with wings, is the heart of the plane.

meanings.definition: The central structure of a rocket.
meanings.sent1: The fuselage of the rocket houses the fuel and engines.
meanings.sent2: The astronauts are seated inside the fuselage during launch.
meanings.sent3: The fuselage of the rocket looked like a sleek metal cylinder.
meanings.sent4: The fuselage, a pillar of strength, propels the rocket into space.
meanings.sent5: The fuselage, a vital part of the rocket, ensures a safe journey.
